intro: Ouratea sipapoensis, commonly known as the Sipapoensis Ouratea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Annonaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its smooth, often glossy leaves and showy, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows as an understory tree in humid, shaded forest environments. The fruit is a fleshy, berry-like structure that contains several seeds, aiding in its dispersal by animals.
